nl.uva.se.imppipes

Class Filter<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • nl.uva.se.imppipes.Filter<I,O>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the values put into this Filter
    O - the type of the values this Filter puts into the next filter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FinalFilter, PlusOneFilter, StartFilter, TimesTwoFilter

    public abstract class Filter<I,O>
extends java.lang.Thread
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A Filter is a Thread for processing elements in a pipe. A filter expect values to be added to it's queue and calls FilterScaler.add(Object) on the next FilterScaler to have the results it produces processed further.
    Author:
    FT_7
    See Also:
    FilterScaler

    • Nested Class Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SLEEP_TIME
      The time this Filter sleeps before trying again when it finds it's queue empty after it is done processing an Object, in ms.

    • Field Detail

      • SLEEP_TIME

        public static final int SLEEP_TIME
        The time this Filter sleeps before trying again when it finds it's queue empty after it is done processing an Object, in ms. The default value is an arbitrary time of 10ms.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Filter

        public Filter()

    • Method Detail

      • setNext

        public void setNext(FilterScaler<O,? extends java.lang.Object> nextFilterScaler)
        Set the FilterScaler this Filter calls add(Object) on to have Objects it has processed, processed further.
        Parameters:
        nextFilterScaler - a FilterScaler which accepts Objects of type O as input

      • setQueue

        public void setQueue(java.util.Queue<I> newQueue)
        Set the queue this Filter should process values from. If the same Queue is passed to multiple Filters, it should be synchronized.
        Parameters:
        newQueue - a Queue of Objects of type I or subtypes of I

      • run

        public void run()
        This method should not be called manually but is called by Thread.start() when that method is called to run this Filter. While running, a Filter gets and removes an Object from it's queue, processes it, adds the result to next and goes on with the next Object from it's queue. When the queue is empty, a Filter sleeps for SLEEP_TIME before trying to get an Object to process again.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • process

        public abstract O process(I input)
        Processes a value. This method defines what this Filter does with each value it gets from it's queue before adding it to the next FilterScaler.
        Parameters:
        input - the value to process
        Returns:
        the result of processing input

      • clone

        public abstract java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a Filter of the same type as this Filter, processing input from the same queue and adding the results to the same FilterScaler. N.B. This method can be inconsistent with Object.equals(java.lang.Object) and Object.hashCode().
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        copyNextAndQueue(Filter, Filter)

      • stopExecution

        public boolean stopExecution()
        Stops the execution of this Filter. Makes run() terminate as soon as this Filter's queue becomes empty.
        Returns:
        true when this Filter has finished running
